Here's what you can do:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>You can update a member's email address, but this will change their primary email, not add a secondary one.</li>\n<li>It's not possible to transfer cards from one user to another.</li>\n<li>When you have multiple accounts, you need to choose which account to issue cards under. Here's how it works:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>We send a replacement card 30 days before your current card expires.</li>\n<li>You'll receive an email notification about the new card.</li>\n<li>You can continue using your old card until the new one arrives.</li>\n<li>Once you receive the new card, activate it using our Web or Mobile app.</li>\n<li>After activation, your old card will be automatically terminated.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>For virtual cards, automatic renewal isn't possible. Here are some common causes and solutions:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>You may have locked the card yourself: Check the Wallet in our web or mobile app and see if you can unlock it by clicking the \"Lock Card\" button.</li>\n<li>Failed Strong Customer Authentication (SCA): This can happen if our app needs updating, you entered an SMS code incorrectly, or a payment was canceled. If you suspect this, please contact our support team through our support form.</li>\n<li>Other reasons include: reaching card or organizational limits, using a wrong PIN, failed customer authentication, attempting to use a disallowed merchant, or trying to make a transaction in a prohibited country.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To resolve the issue, check the transaction details in our app for the specific decline reason and recommended action.             "Pliant: <p>The \"Edit member data\" option might be greyed out because you don't have the necessary permissions to make changes. Only Owners or Admins can edit a team member's name using this option. If you're not an Owner or Admin, you won't be able to make these changes.</p>\n<p>As an alternative, each member can edit their own name in their user profile by clicking the pen symbol next to their name. If the team member needs to update their name, you can ask them to do it themselves through their profile, or request assistance from an Owner or Admin of your organization.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316745-managing-members\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Managing members</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090566-your-user-profile\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Your user profile</a></p>",

            "Stefanie Potikoglou: <p>We have two virtual cards for Synformulas, ending -6642 and -4036. Is it possible to receive a billing statement per card?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We don't provide separate billing statements for individual virtual cards. Instead, we offer a single, comprehensive statement that includes all transactions from all cards in your organization.</p>\n<p>However, we do provide ways to analyze spending at a more granular level:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Monthly Statement PDF: This gives an overview of all transactions and payments for the month.</li>\n<li>CSV download: This comprehensive file includes transaction data with additional data points, allowing you to analyze spending per card, cardholder, or team/cost center.</li>\n<li>Card Account Page: You can view all booked transactions and generate on-demand statements. You can also download this data in CSV format or get receipts in a ZIP file.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>These tools should help you track spending for your specific virtual cards ending in -6642 and -4036.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316752-understanding-billing-statements-and-bill-payments\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding billing statements and bill payments</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9507077-billing-statements\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Billing statements</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9515100-card-account-page\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card Account Page</a></p>",

            "Sara Yousefi: <div class=\"intercom-container\"><img src=\"https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/y4r5as1r/1343072340/bd22330742baa3bc75d1fc56ff08/%7B23467E28-E148-4225-841B-EA89954C143F%7D.png?expires=1737476100&amp;signature=4435c981ba1496df965234118617d76897c8adca4e764113801c8e61afbf63fd&amp;req=dSMjFcl5n4JbWfMW1HO4zd26H73A80mr3P94nCxCSGIyZLkjdKPuOSdAdNc2%0A0s2L65FWxOJ8%2BnxuLO8%3D%0A\"></div>",
            "Pliant: <p>To get the invoice for your PLIANT PREMIUM transaction, you have a couple of options:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Monthly Statement: We generate a Monthly Statement PDF on the second working day of the following month. You can access this document on our <a href=\"https://app.getpliant.com/admin/billing-statements\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Statements page</a> by clicking the \"Download\" button next to the relevant statement period.</li>\n<li>Live Card Account Page: For more immediate access, you can use our <a href=\"https://app.getpliant.com/admin/account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card account page</a>. Here, you can see all booked transactions and download them in CSV format. You can also obtain receipts for the transactions in a ZIP file.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To find your specific transaction, you may need to apply filters before downloading. Remember, the October transaction will be included in the November statement, as we generate statements at the start of the following month.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9507077-billing-statements\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Billing statements</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9515100-card-account-page\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card Account Page</a></p>",

        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Nico H√∂glund: <p>Is there a way to export the list off active cards to csv or similar?</p>",
            "Nico H√∂glund: <p>Or a way to search for cards based on cost centers assigned</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Yes, we can help you with both exporting active cards and searching for cards based on cost centers.</p>\n<p>For exporting active cards, we offer a \"List of All Credit Cards\" that includes detailed information such as card limits, transaction limits, and card types. You can request this list from our system.</p>\n<p>Regarding searching for cards based on cost centers, you can use the team/cost center assignment feature. Cards can be assigned to specific teams or cost centers, which allows for easier tracking and management. To find cards assigned to a particular cost center, you can navigate to the Cards menu item and use the filtering options available.</p>\n<p>For more detailed instructions on managing these features, you may want to check the Card Account Page in our admin app.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316747-managing-cards-via-the-admin-app\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Managing cards via the admin app</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6455003-setting-up-cost-centers-teams\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Setting up cost centers (teams)</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9038130-request-entity-data\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Request entity data</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>We have a system in place to handle transactions that violate company policies. When a transaction is flagged as \"Out of Policy,\" it indicates a business expense that has breached internal company policy.</p>\n<p>Team managers, admins, or owners can flag these transactions in the Cardholder App under the \"Needs Review\" tab. They can add explanations in the note field when flagging a transaction.</p>\n<p>While we don't automatically notify cardholders about flagged transactions, we do send email notifications for important account updates. To ensure cardholders receive these notifications, make sure their email notification settings are turned on. They can manage these settings in their Profile Details under \"Manage Notifications.\"</p>\n<p>For more specific notification needs, you may need to contact our support team for assistance.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/8329619-transaction-review\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Transaction Review</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/10086115-flag-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Flag transactions</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6460330-managing-email-notifications\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Managing email notifications</a></p>",

This shipping date can be found in the card history.</p>\n<p>If the card did not arrive after 2 weeks or more, please make sure the shipping address is correctly entered within the <a href=\"https://app.getpliant.com/admin/settings/organization\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">company platform</a> and cancel the outstanding card and reissue it.</p>",

            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Patrick Wirth: <p>I would like to get a physical cart for an existing virtual cart is this doable?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Yes, you can request a physical card in addition to your existing virtual card. Here's how:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to the \"Wallet\" section in our web or mobile app.</li>\n<li>Click \"Request new card\" (web) or tap the plus sign (mobile).</li>\n<li>Choose the physical card option.</li>\n<li>Fill in the required details and submit your request.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Keep in mind that you can only have one physical card at a time per organization account. The approval process involves your organization's account owners and admins. Once approved, delivery typically takes 1-2 weeks.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6460960-requesting-a-card\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Requesting a card</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090567-card-types-physical-and-virtual-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card types - physical and virtual cards</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Was that helpful?</p>",
            "Patrick Wirth: <p>No</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>I apologize for not meeting your expectations. Is there anything specific I can clarify or assist you with?</p>",
            "Patrick Wirth: <p>I would like to have a physical cart for an existing virtual cart, not a new one.</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>I apologize, but it's not possible to convert an existing virtual card into a physical card. Each card type is separate, and you can't transform one into the other. However, you can request a new physical card in addition to your existing virtual card. Here's how:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to the \"Wallet\" section in our web or mobile app.</li>\n<li>Click \"Request new card\" (web) or tap the plus sign (mobile).</li>\n<li>Choose the physical card option.</li>\n<li>Fill in the required details and submit your request.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Keep in mind that you can only have one physical card at a time per organization account. The approval process involves your organization's account owners and admins. Once approved, delivery typically takes 5-10 working days.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090567-card-types-physical-and-virtual-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card types - physical and virtual cards</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6460960-requesting-a-card\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Requesting a card</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316746-issuing-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Issuing cards</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>If you've entered your PIN incorrectly three times, don't worry. To unlock your card, simply take it to an ATM and perform a Chip and PIN transaction, such as a cash withdrawal. You don't need to complete the withdrawal; this process will reset your number of PIN tries. This action will unlock your card, allowing you to use it again.</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316730-viewing-the-pliant-card-s-pin\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Viewing the Pliant card's PIN</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>To activate his account, Calvin should try updating his phone number. Here's how:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>He should log into the Pliant web app.</li>\n<li>In his user profile, he can click the pen icon next to his phone number to change it.</li>\n<li>This will trigger an email with a link to reset the number.</li>\n<li>After entering the new number, he'll need to confirm it via an SMS code.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If he can't access the app due to 2FA issues, an admin or owner can reset his phone number through the admin app.</p>\n<p>Unfortunately, you can't use your number instead, as each user needs their own mobile number for account security and authentication.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090566-your-user-profile\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Your user profile</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7991702-updating-the-phone-number\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Updating The Phone Number</a></p>",

        "message(by Daniela Kr√§uter)": "<p>Accounting and billing</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you with accounting and billing? </p>",
            "Daniela Kr√§uter: <p>is it possible that the billing of each card will be done through the users bank account instead the company account?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>No, it's not possible for the billing of each card to be done through individual user bank accounts. Our billing setup is designed for simplicity and flexibility at the organization level. We provide a single statement that aggregates all card transactions made by any of the organization's cardholders.</p>\n<p>The billing account is set for the entire company, usually during onboarding. If you need to change the billing account, an admin user who is also a legal representative of your organization can do so through the Bank Accounts page in the app. This change affects the entire organization, not individual cards or users.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316754-change-the-company-s-billing-account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Change the company‚Äôs billing account</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316752-understanding-billing-statements-and-bill-payments\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding billing statements and bill payments</a></p>",

            "Janina Lipp: <p>Hello, in November we had seven transactions as deposit from Caesars LV, currency was USD. In December the amounts were reimbursed, since we didn't execute the booking. The FX Fees on these amounts were not reimbursed. We expect them to be reimbursed as well, since the payments were not finally carried out.</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>FX fees are calculated and applied as soon as a transaction is booked, regardless of whether the transaction is later reimbursed or reversed. These fees are part of our standard process for handling foreign currency transactions.</p>\n<p>To address your specific situation with the Caesars LV transactions, we recommend contacting our customer support team. They can review your case and determine if a refund of the FX fees is possible. You can reach out to us through the chat in our mobile or web app, or by submitting a ticket via our Support Form.</p>\n<p>For future reference, FX fees are calculated at 2% of the transaction amount, unless a special rate applies to your organization. You can check your applicable FX fee rate on the Organization &gt; Plan page in your account settings.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9981049-fees-on-fx-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Fees on FX transactions</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090571-understanding-card-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding card transactions</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Erik Gerwick: <p>currently I must approve every transaction for all employee cards.  How do I disable this for all transactions under 500 euro for example?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We don't have a direct way to disable transaction approvals for amounts under 500 euros. However, we can help you customize the Transaction Review settings to better suit your needs.</p>\n<p>To adjust the review process:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to Settings &gt; Modules</li>\n<li>Activate the Transaction Review module</li>\n<li>Configure the review criteria to fit your requirements</li>\n</ol>\n<p>You can:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Limit reviews to transactions assigned to specific teams</li>\n<li>Deactivate the feature for certain teams on the Teams page</li>\n<li>Enable \"Mandatory Review For Export\" if needed</li>\n</ul>\n<p>These options can help streamline the review process, though they don't allow for automatic approval based on transaction amount. For more specific adjustments, you may need to contact our support team for assistance.</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/8329619-transaction-review\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Transaction Review</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>To update an employee's last name on their credit card due to marriage, you'll need to update their member information in our system. Here's how:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>As an Owner or Admin, go to the Members section in the admin app.</li>\n<li>Find the employee and select \"Edit member data\" from the member menu.</li>\n<li>Update their last name in the system.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>The employee should also update their name in their user profile by clicking the pen symbol next to their name.</p>\n<p>After updating the information in our system, the new last name will be reflected on future card replacements or new card issues. There are a few possible explanations for this:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Top-up processing time: If you initiated a top-up, it typically takes about two bank working days for the funds to appear in your Pliant account.</li>\n<li>Bill payment timing: If this was a scheduled bill payment, the available balance in your Pliant account changes only after the payment is fully processed, usually one bank working day after the booking date.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To check the status of your payment, please look at the Payments page in your Pliant dashboard. They can be given the \"Accountant\" role, which has limited access to the admin app, primarily for managing accounting settings and preparing transactions for export. This role is specifically designed for external accounting experts who help with monthly bookkeeping. The accounting features, including pre-accounting and exporting credit card data, are available to users with owner, admin, or accountant permissions within the web app. However, the sources don't specify if there's a separate pricing structure for accountant roles or if they count towards your team member limit.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090556-member-roles-and-permissions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Member roles and permissions</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316775-getting-started-using-pliant-s-accounting-features\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Getting started using Pliant's accounting features</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>Tax advisors don't count as full team members in the same way as regular employees. They can be given the \"Accountant\" role, which has limited access to the admin app, primarily for managing accounting settings and preparing transactions for export. This role is specifically designed for external accounting experts who help with monthly bookkeeping. The accounting features, including pre-accounting and exporting credit card data, are available to users with owner, admin, or accountant permissions within the web app. However, the sources don't specify if there's a separate pricing structure for accountant roles or if they count towards your team member limit.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090556-member-roles-and-permissions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Member roles and permissions</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316775-getting-started-using-pliant-s-accounting-features\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Getting started using Pliant's accounting features</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "David Teryadi: <p>Is there an option to extent the Credit Card Validity?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Unfortunately, it's not possible to extend the validity of a credit card. However, we have an automatic replacement process for physical cards:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>We'll send you a new card 30 days before your current one expires.</li>\n<li>You can continue using your old card until the new one arrives.</li>\n<li>Once you receive the new card, activate it using our Web or Mobile app. This will automatically deactivate the old card.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>For virtual cards, we don't extend validity periods. Instead, you'll need to replace an expired virtual card with a new one.</p>\n<p>If you have any specific concerns about your card's expiration, please let me know, and I'll be happy to provide more information.</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9060891-card-expiration\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card expiration</a></p>",

This can happen if:<br>‚Ä¢ The Pliant mobile app needs updating to receive the 3DS push notification.<br>‚Ä¢ Ryanair didn't send an SCA request, which is required for the payment.</li>\n<li>There might be a temporary block on the 3DS function if a previous payment was cancelled or an incorrect code was entered.</li>\n<li>Other possible reasons for declined transactions include:<br>‚Ä¢ Card limit reached<br>‚Ä¢ Organizational limit reached<br>‚Ä¢ Failed customer authentication</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To resolve this, check the transaction details in the Pliant app for the specific decline reason.             "Pliant: <p>No, a private individual cannot transfer money back to the Pliant account. We only accept funds sent from corporate accounts that have the same name as your legal entity. Transfers from personal accounts, PayPal, or other similar networks will be rejected. This applies to both credit and prefunded accounts. When topping up your account, it's important to use bank accounts with the same name as your organization name to avoid rejection of the transfer.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9515091-top-up-money-in-your-account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Top up money in your account</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/8222411-top-up-for-credit-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Top-up for Credit Accounts</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>To create a custom field in the accounting settings, follow these steps:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to Settings &gt; Accounting.</li>\n<li>Click on the \"+ Add Custom Field\" button.</li>\n<li>Choose either a text-based field or a \"Dropdown\" (Select) type.</li>\n<li>Provide a name for the field, a short description, and an optional default value.</li>\n<li>Set the field's visibility and whether it's mandatory for exports or card creation.</li>\n<li>For dropdown fields, add pre-set options and optionally set a default value.</li>\n<li>Click Save to create the custom field.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Remember, custom fields are part of our Standard plan and higher. They can be used to add specific data to transactions, such as locations, departments, or client IDs.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9244962-custom-fields\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Custom Fields</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/10257030-custom-field-select-type\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Custom Field: \"Select\" Type</a></p>",

To resolve this:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Ensure you're using a compatible browser. You can check browser support <a href=\"https://webauthn.me/browser-support\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">here</a>.</li>\n<li>If the issue persists, try logging in using a different authentication method.         "message(by Andreas Kaya-Fill)": "<p>Other</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help?</p>",
            "Andreas Kaya-Fill: <p>login does not work</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>There could be several reasons why your login isn't working. Here are some possible causes and solutions:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Incorrect password: Ensure you're entering the correct password. It must be at least 8 characters long and include 3 out of 4 character types (lowercase, uppercase, numbers, special characters).</li>\n<li>Two-factor authentication (2FA) issues: We require 2FA for added security. Make sure you have access to your registered phone number to receive the SMS code.</li>\n<li>Outdated mobile number: If you've changed your phone number, you may not receive the 2FA code. Update your number in your user profile or ask an admin to do it for you.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If you're still having trouble, try resetting your password from the login page. For further assistance, please contact our support team.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316679-securely-accessing-your-account-2fa\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Securely accessing your account (2FA)</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090566-your-user-profile\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Your user profile</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9038080-password-security-at-pliant\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Password Security at Pliant</a></p>",

            "Sander West: <p>Yesterday we have issued a wire transfer in order to top up our credit limit. When will it be processed?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Typically, wire transfers for topping up your credit limit are processed within 2-3 working days. The funds usually arrive in your account two bank working days after the transfer is made. Once processed and approved by us, the available balance will reflect the added amount. If you don't see the top-up reflected in your account after this timeframe, please submit a request using our support form with proof of transfer details.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/8222411-top-up-for-credit-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Top-up for Credit Accounts</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9515091-top-up-money-in-your-account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Top up money in your account</a></p>",

            "Mathias K√ºrten: <p>Eine Frage zu einer Transaktion von Herrn Wolf √ºber 10,95‚Ç¨. Dieser Betrag taucht in ihrer Monatsanrechnung f√ºr November 2024 auf. Er befindet sich aber nicht  in Circula, auch nicht in unter den noch nicht eingereichten Belegen. Er taucht dort gar nicht auf.</p>",
            "Mathias K√ºrten: <p>Bitte dahingehend um EErkl√§rtung und Hilfestellung</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>There could be a few reasons for this discrepancy:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>The transaction might not have synced properly between Pliant and Circula. Check if Mr. Wolf's email address is the same in both systems, as this is crucial for syncing.</li>\n<li>The transaction might have been manually deleted in Circula. If this happens, it won't re-sync from Pliant.</li>\n<li>The transaction might be pending confirmation from the bank. Pliant expenses can only be added to Circula once fully confirmed.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To resolve this, you can:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Verify the email addresses match in both systems.</li>\n<li>Check if the transaction is still pending confirmation.</li>\n<li>If needed, create a manual transaction in Circula for this expense.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If the issue persists, contact our support team for further assistance.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316771-using-pliant-with-circula\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Using Pliant with Circula</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9507077-billing-statements\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Billing statements</a></p>",

        "message(by Gerard Kijlstra)": "<p>Accounting and billing</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you with accounting and billing? </p>",
            "Gerard Kijlstra: <p>I have topped up our balance with 5.000 but our invoices keep getting declined</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>There could be a few reasons why your invoices are still being declined despite topping up. First, it's important to note that top-ups can take up to two business days to reflect in your account. If you've recently topped up, the funds may not have been processed yet.</p>\n<p>If it's been more than two days, check your Statements page to see if the top-up has been booked. Also, keep in mind that if you had an outstanding balance, the top-up amount would first be used to recover that balance before adding to your available funds.</p>\n<p>If you're still experiencing issues, please contact our support team through the chat in our app or by submitting a ticket via our Support Form for further assistance.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/8222411-top-up-for-credit-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Top-up for Credit Accounts</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9515077-bill-payments\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Bill payments</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9515091-top-up-money-in-your-account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Top up money in your account</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Did that answer your question?</p>",
            "Gerard Kijlstra: <p>Where is the statements page?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>You can find the Statements page by going to <a href=\"https://app.getpliant.com/admin/billing-statements\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">https://app.getpliant.com/admin/billing-statements</a>. This page shows high-level information about each statement period, including starting and ending balances, total transactions, and payments. If you have multiple accounts, you can switch between them using the drop-down menu in the top left of the Statements page.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9507077-billing-statements\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Billing statements</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9595857-multi-currency-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Multi-currency accounts</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>We understand you're inquiring about the duration of the compliance review for your new account. While we don't have specific information about your particular case, we can provide some general insights.</p>\n<p>The compliance review, also known as know-your-customer (KYC) due diligence, is a required process for all financial service providers, including us. This process is mandated by law to verify the identity of our customers and understand the nature of our business relationships.</p>\n<p>Even though you've been through this process before with us, each new account typically requires its own review. The duration can vary depending on various factors. However, since you're an existing customer, this might potentially expedite the process.</p>\n<p>For more specific information about your case, we recommend reaching out to our support team directly.         "message(by Katharina Hirsch)": "<p>Other</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Katharina Hirsch: <p>Was hei√üt Belegdateien einbezogen und referenziert werden sollen. Antwort bitte auf deutsch.</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>When we talk about receipt files being included and referenced, it means that when you request a custom export format for your transaction data, you can specify how you want receipt files to be handled. This could involve including the actual receipt files (usually in PDF format) along with the transaction data, and establishing a way to link or reference these files to their corresponding transactions in the export. For example, when downloading transactions, you can get a ZIP file that includes all the corresponding receipt files of those transactions. This ensures that all necessary documentation is available and properly linked for accounting and record-keeping purposes.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7325313-custom-export-format\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Custom export format</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316748-tracking-card-transactions-in-the-admin-app\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Tracking card transactions in the admin app</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Is that what you were looking for?</p>",
            "Katharina Hirsch: <p>auf deutsch</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Wenn wir von \"Belegdateien einbeziehen und referenzieren\" sprechen, bedeutet das Folgendes:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Bei einem benutzerdefinierten Exportformat k√∂nnen Sie festlegen, wie Belegdateien behandelt werden sollen.</li>\n<li>Dies kann beinhalten, dass die tats√§chlichen Belegdateien (meist im PDF-Format) zusammen mit den Transaktionsdaten exportiert werden.</li>\n<li>Es wird eine Verkn√ºpfung zwischen den Belegdateien und den entsprechenden Transaktionen im Export hergestellt.</li>\n<li>Beim Herunterladen von Transaktionen k√∂nnen Sie eine ZIP-Datei erhalten, die alle zugeh√∂rigen Belegdateien dieser Transaktionen enth√§lt.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Dies stellt sicher, dass alle notwendigen Dokumente verf√ºgbar und f√ºr Buchhaltungs- und Aufzeichnungszwecke ordnungsgem√§√ü verkn√ºpft sind.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7325313-custom-export-format\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Custom export format</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316748-tracking-card-transactions-in-the-admin-app\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Tracking card transactions in the admin app</a></p>",

The general FX fee rate is 2%, but your organization may have a special rate.             "Serap Hardal: <p>Hallo, leider steht beim Mitarbeiter der Kartennutzer ist \"Buchhalter\", obwohl bei den Berechntigungen der Haken bei Buchhaltungseinstellungen nicht gesezt ist. </p>",
            "Pliant: <p>The discrepancy you're seeing might be due to the difference between roles and permissions in our system. The \"Accountant\" designation refers to a specific role, while the accounting settings permissions are a separate feature that can be enabled or disabled for certain roles.</p>\n<p>In our system, the Accountant role is primarily designed for setting up and managing the organization's accounting settings, preparing transactions for export, and ensuring proper accounting data assignment. However, the ability to modify accounting settings is a permission that can be controlled separately by Owners and Admins.</p>\n<p>It's possible that the employee has been assigned the Accountant role, but the specific permission to modify accounting settings has not been granted. This would explain why they're listed as an \"Accountant\" but don't have the checkbox for accounting settings permissions selected.</p>\n<p>To resolve this, you may want to review the role assignment and specific permissions for this employee. If you need to adjust these settings, an Owner or Admin can modify them as needed.</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090556-member-roles-and-permissions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Member roles and permissions</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Was that helpful?</p>",

You can request this export via the accounting export feature, and the file will be emailed to you.</li>\n<li>Download CSV from Statements page: For each statement period, you can download a comprehensive CSV file that includes transaction and payment information, along with additional data points. As an Owner or Admin, you can invite the new board member by following these steps:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to the \"Dashboard\" or \"Members\" page</li>\n<li>Click on the \"Invite member\" button</li>\n<li>Enter the new board member's details (title, first name, last name, and email address)</li>\n<li>Select the appropriate role, likely \"Owner\" for a board member</li>\n<li>Send the invite</li>\n</ol>\n<p>The new board member will receive an email invitation to join the platform. As an Owner, they will have full control of the company's Pliant account, including the ability to manage members, issue cards, and change account settings.</p>\n<p>Remember, you can always adjust roles and permissions later if needed.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316744-inviting-a-member\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Inviting a member</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090556-member-roles-and-permissions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Member roles and permissions</a></p>",

        "message(by Michaela Neidl)": "<p>Accounting and billing</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you with accounting and billing? </p>",
            "Michaela Neidl: <p>receipt allocation does not work anymore for main supplier</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>There could be a few reasons why receipt allocation isn't working for your main supplier. First, check if the supplier is still active in your system. Suppliers can be deactivated, which prevents new transactions from being assigned to them.</p>\n<p>Also, ensure that the Receipt Inbox feature is working correctly. If receipts aren't being matched to transactions, they'll appear in the \"Unmatched\" tab of the Receipt Inbox.</p>\n<p>If the issue persists, review your receipt management settings. Make sure notifications for missing receipts are enabled and that the receipt forwarding feature is set up correctly if you're using it.</p>\n<p>If you've checked these areas and still have problems, you may need to contact our support team for further assistance.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6491261-setting-up-supplier-creditor-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Setting up supplier creditor accounts</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7325327-receipt-management-settings\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Receipt management settings</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9772828-receipt-inbox\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Receipt Inbox</a></p>",

        "message(by Katja Marzisz)": "<p>Accounting and billing</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you with accounting and billing? </p>",
            "Katja Marzisz: <p>We transfered money to our account on Jan 07, 2025 and it still doesnt show on our dashboard</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>There are a few reasons why the money you transferred on Jan 07, 2025 might not be showing on your dashboard yet:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Processing time: Top-ups typically take 1-3 business days to be credited to your Pliant account. As it's only been a few days since your transfer, it may still be processing.</li>\n<li>Visibility timeframe: Top-ups are usually visible within 2-3 working days. If it's been longer than this, you may need to contact support.</li>\n<li>Balance allocation: When the top-up is approved, it first covers any outstanding balance from your credit limit before appearing as additional funds.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If your top-up isn't visible after 2-3 working days, please submit a support request with proof of transfer, including sender details, amount, and transfer date/time.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/8222411-top-up-for-credit-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Top-up for Credit Accounts</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7924887-pre-fund-pliant-account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Pre-fund Pliant Account</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Is that what you were looking for?</p>",
            "Katja Marzisz: <p>how do i submit a support request?</p>",

            "Pliant: <p>As an Owner or Admin, you can update most users' email addresses by clicking the \"Update email address\" button in the member menu item \"Edit member data\". However, there are two exceptions:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Only an Owner can update another Owner's email address.</li>\n<li>For users with access to multiple organizational accounts, email updates must be done through Pliant customer service for security reasons.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If you're unable to change some users' email addresses, it's likely due to these exceptions. In such cases, please contact our customer service for assistance.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316745-managing-members\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Managing members</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090566-your-user-profile\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Your user profile</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>There could be a few reasons why you're not receiving the verification code:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Your mobile device might not be paired with your Pliant account. When paired, you receive 3DS push notifications instead of SMS codes.</li>\n<li>If you've recently cancelled a payment or entered an incorrect code, the 3DS function might be temporarily blocked for security reasons.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To resolve this:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Try unpairing and re-pairing your device in the Pliant mobile app under \"Security\" in your profile settings.</li>\n<li>If the issue persists, you can unpair your device completely to switch to SMS verification.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If you're still having trouble, please reach out to our support team for assistance.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7980024-strong-customer-authentication\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Strong-Customer Authentication</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6452385-pairing-a-mobile-device-2fa\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Pairing a mobile device (2FA)</a></p>",

            "Marco Velardi: <p>cashback</p>",
            "Marco Velardi: <p>can i talk to a human?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We offer cashback on purchases made with your Pliant card. The cashback is earned in the currency of the account used for the transaction. For example, if you have accounts in EUR, USD, and GBP, you'll earn cashback in those respective currencies.</p>\n<p>If you're using a credit line, the cashback will be issued in the same currency as the account. For instance, if your credit line is in USD, any cashback earned from transactions will also be in USD.</p>\n<p>To maximize your cashback, you might want to consider the frequency of your bill payments. Would you like more information about how bill payment frequency affects cashback amounts?</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9595857-multi-currency-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Multi-currency accounts</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9974248-multi-currency-credit-line\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Multi-currency credit line</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9707104-multi-currency-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Multi-currency accounts</a></p>",

        "message(by Sven Tissen)": "<p>Accounting and billing</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you with accounting and billing? </p>",
            "Sven Tissen: <p>SEPA Lastschrift</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We typically use SEPA direct debit (SDD) for bill payments. Here's how it works:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>We'll send you an email notification two bank working days before withdrawing funds, including a CSV file with transaction details.</li>\n<li>For most customers, we only need a standard SEPA CORE mandate, which you can grant within our app.</li>\n<li>If you need to change your billing account, an admin user who's also a legal representative can do so in the Bank Accounts page of our app.</li>\n<li>If a payment fails, we'll notify you via email and attempt three retries. Our customer service team will also reach out to resolve any issues.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Remember to inform us if you anticipate any problems with upcoming direct debits.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316752-understanding-billing-statements-and-bill-payments\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding billing statements and bill payments</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316754-change-the-company-s-billing-account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Change the company‚Äôs billing account</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9515077-bill-payments\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Bill payments</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Was that helpful?</p>",

            "Pliant: <p>There could be several reasons why your card is being declined when trying to purchase an Adobe subscription, even if you've entered the details correctly. Some possible causes include:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Card limits: Your card may have reached its transaction or monthly limit.</li>\n<li>Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) failure: The transaction might require additional verification, which could be failing.</li>\n<li>Merchant issues: Sometimes, the payment request isn't sent to us if rejected by the payment process provider.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To resolve this, check your transaction details in our app for the specific decline reason and recommended action. If the issue persists, contact Adobe to ensure they're correctly processing the payment on their end.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090571-understanding-card-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding card transactions</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6466476-declined-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Declined transactions</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7980024-strong-customer-authentication\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Strong-Customer Authentication</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Katja Marzisz: <p>Hi, I transferred an amount to our account so we can start using the credit cards. But it does not show the balance yet. How long does it usually take until the transferred money is available?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>When you top up your Pliant account, the funds typically take about 2-3 working days to become visible in your available balance. Once the top-up is complete and approved, the available balance will reflect the added amount.</p>\n<p>The exact timing can vary depending on the transfer method used. For local transfers (like SEPA in the Euro area), funds may arrive on the same day or the next working day. SWIFT transfers for cross-border transactions usually take 1-3 working days.</p>\n<p>If your top-up isn't visible after 2-3 working days, you can submit a support request with proof of transfer.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/8222411-top-up-for-credit-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Top-up for Credit Accounts</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9515091-top-up-money-in-your-account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Top up money in your account</a></p>",

        "message(by Julian Weiss)": "<p>Other</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Julian Weiss: <p>Enable Datev API Integration &amp; File Export</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>To enable DATEV API integration and file export, follow these steps:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Submit a ticket requesting DATEV activation through our chat, help button, or website.</li>\n<li>Once activated, check Settings - Integrations in the Pliant web app to confirm.</li>\n<li>Ensure prerequisites are met, including correct DATEV client setup and activation of DATEV Invoice Data Service 1.0.</li>\n<li>Set up general accounts in Pliant under Settings - Accounting - General.</li>\n<li>Connect DATEV Datenservices in Settings - Accounting - DATEV. Follow the prompts to log in to DATEV and grant necessary permissions.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>After setup, you can export transactions via API or download as DATEV XML/CSV files.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6867482-step-1-activate-datev-integration\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Step 1: Activate DATEV Integration</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6898916-step-2-prerequisite-to-set-up-the-datev-api\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Step 2: Prerequisite to set up the DATEV API</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6899124-step-3-setup-of-the-datev-api-via-datev-rechnungsdatenservice-1-0\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Step 3: Setup of the DATEV API via DATEV Rechnungsdatenservice 1.0</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Was that helpful?</p>",
            "Julian Weiss: <p>Please Activate DATEV Integration</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>To activate the DATEV API integration for your account, follow these steps:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Submit a ticket requesting DATEV activation through our chat, help button, or website.</li>\n<li>Once activated, check Settings - Integrations in our web app to confirm.</li>\n<li>Ensure prerequisites are met, including correct DATEV client setup and activation of DATEV Invoice Data Service 1.0.</li>\n<li>Set up general accounts in Pliant under Settings - Accounting - General.</li>\n<li>Connect DATEV Datenservices in Settings - Accounting - DATEV. Follow the prompts to log in to DATEV and grant necessary permissions.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>After setup, you can export transactions via API or download as DATEV XML/CSV files.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6867482-step-1-activate-datev-integration\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Step 1: Activate DATEV Integration</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6899124-step-3-setup-of-the-datev-api-via-datev-rechnungsdatenservice-1-0\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Step 3: Setup of the DATEV API via DATEV Rechnungsdatenservice 1.0</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6898916-step-2-prerequisite-to-set-up-the-datev-api\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Step 2: Prerequisite to set up the DATEV API</a></p>",

        "message(by Heike Kaiser)": "<p>Accounting and billing</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you with accounting and billing? </p>",
            "Heike Kaiser: <p>Was beinhaltet die FX fee von 2%, die seit September auf den Rechnungen steht?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>The 2% FX fee covers foreign exchange transactions. It applies to transactions made in a currency different from your card account's currency. For example, if you have a EUR card and make a purchase in USD, it would be considered an FX transaction.</p>\n<p>This fee is calculated when a transaction is booked and added to your monthly invoice. The total FX fee on your invoice is the sum of all FX fees for transactions made that month.</p>\n<p>You can check your specific FX fee rate on the Organization &gt; Plan page in your account, as some organizations may have special rates.</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9981049-fees-on-fx-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Fees on FX transactions</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Did that answer your question?</p>",
            "Heike Kaiser: <p>seit wann wird diese geb√ºhr erhoben?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We apply a 2% FX fee to transactions made in a currency different from your card account's currency. This fee is calculated as soon as a transaction is booked and is included in the monthly invoice at the end of each calendar month.</p>\n<p>To check the specific FX fee rate that applies to your organization, you can visit the Organization &gt; Plan page in your account settings.</p>\n<p>Could you please clarify if you're asking about when this fee was implemented or if you're looking for information about a specific transaction or time period?</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9981049-fees-on-fx-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Fees on FX transactions</a></p>",

        "message(by Enrico Bachmann)": "<p>Accounting and billing</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you with accounting and billing? </p>",
            "Enrico Bachmann: <p>Die Hundeo GmbH wird geschlossen und ich habe nun eine neue Firma in Zypern. Sozusagen eine Funktionsverlagerung der Firma. Kann man das Konto f√ºr die neue Firma √§ndern? Andernfalls m√ºssten wir dieses Konto schlie√üen und es w√§re gut, wenn man mir dann noch das Cashback auszahlt.</p>\n<p>Gr√º√üe<br>Enrico Bachmann</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Unfortunately, we can't directly transfer your account to a new company in Cyprus. However, you have a couple of options:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Change the billing account: If you want to keep the existing account, you can change the billing account to your new company's bank account. This can only be done by a legal representative of the company.</li>\n<li>Close the account and withdraw funds: If you prefer to close the account, you'll need to withdraw your funds, including any cashback earned. You can only withdraw money to a bank account you've previously used for top-ups.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Regarding cashback, it's earned in the currency of the account where transactions were made. You'll need to redeem the cashback for each currency separately before closing the account.</p>\n<p>To proceed with either option or for more specific guidance, please contact our support team directly through the chat in our mobile or web app.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9595857-multi-currency-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Multi-currency accounts</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316754-change-the-company-s-billing-account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Change the company‚Äôs billing account</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9515096-withdrawals-payouts-from-card-accounts\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Withdrawals (payouts) from card accounts</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Was that helpful?</p>",

            "Pliant: <p>You can terminate your card at any time if it's lost, stolen, compromised, or no longer needed. Here's how to do it:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to the \"Wallet\" in the web or mobile app.</li>\n<li>Click the edit button in the top right corner of the card.</li>\n<li>Select \"Terminate card\".</li>\n<li>Choose a termination reason and confirm.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Once terminated, the card will be disabled for future use, and any subsequent transactions will be declined. However, you'll still be able to view previous transactions made with this card on the Transactions page.</p>\n<p>Is there a specific reason you're looking to close your card?             "Pliant: <p>Refunds can take some time to process and appear on your Pliant card. When a merchant initiates a refund, it doesn't immediately show up on your account. The refund may still be in a pending state, which can last up to 7 days.</p>\n<p>To check the status of your refund:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Log into your Pliant Cardholder App (web or mobile).</li>\n<li>Look for the refund transaction in your list of card transactions.</li>\n<li>Check if it's marked as \"PENDING\" or \"BOOKED\".</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If you don't see the refund after 7 days, please contact our customer support through the chat in our app or via our Support Form for further assistance.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090571-understanding-card-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding card transactions</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316732-your-card-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Your card transactions</a></p>",

            "Cristina Talaya: <p>Uno de mis proveedores no ha recibido el pago que aparece cargado en mi cuenta</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>There could be several reasons why your supplier hasn't received a payment that appears charged to your account. Here are some possibilities:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>The payment might still be in process. Bill payments are typically made via SEPA direct debit, which can take a few business days to complete.</li>\n<li>The payment might have been unsuccessful. If a bill payment fails, you should receive an email notification. Our system will attempt to retry the payment up to three times.</li>\n<li>There might be a delay due to payment terms. If your organization has deferred payment terms (14 or 30 days), this could explain the delay.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To check the status of your payment, you can view the Payments page in your Pliant account. Here's how you can approach this:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Create separate virtual cards for each employee. This allows for more flexibility and better control over individual spending limits.</li>\n<li>Set up teams or cost centers for different bonus levels. You can then assign cards to these teams, which helps in managing budgets for groups of employees.</li>\n<li>Adjust the monthly limit for each card to match the specific bonus amount you want to assign to each employee.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>This way, each employee will only see their own card balance, and you can manage bonus amounts individually. Remember, for security reasons, card details should never be shared among multiple people.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6454972-setting-up-and-managing-teams\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Setting up and managing teams</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090567-card-types-physical-and-virtual-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card types - physical and virtual cards</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316747-managing-cards-via-the-admin-app\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Managing cards via the admin app</a></p>",

        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you with accounting and billing? </p>",
            "Bj√∂rn Bombosch: <p>Guten Morgen, mir ist gerade aufgefallen, dass seit September Pliant Platform Fee erhoben wird</p>",
            "Bj√∂rn Bombosch: <p>was hat es damit aufsich?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We apply a fee to FX transactions (transactions in a currency different from your card account's currency). The general FX fee is 2% of the transaction amount, but your organization may have a special rate. This fee is calculated when a transaction is booked and added to your monthly invoice at the end of each calendar month. To check your specific FX fee rate, you can visit the Organization &gt; Plan page in your account settings.</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9981049-fees-on-fx-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Fees on FX transactions</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Is that what you were looking for?</p>",
            "Bj√∂rn Bombosch: <p>was it added newly in 2024?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>The Pliant Platform Fee, which appears to be referring to the FX fee, was not newly added in 2024. This fee has been a part of Pliant's pricing structure for some time. It's applied to transactions made in a currency different from your card account's currency. The standard rate is 2% of the transaction amount, but your organization may have a special rate. The fee is calculated when a transaction is booked and added to your monthly invoice at the end of each calendar month.</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9981049-fees-on-fx-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Fees on FX transactions</a></p>",

        "message(by Alessio Piano)": "<p>Other</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help?</p>",
            "Alessio Piano: <p>refund</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>To request a refund for your purchase or subscription, you can initiate a chargeback process. We handle this through our customer support channels. You can contact us through the chat in our mobile or web app, or by submitting a ticket via our Support Form. Our customer support team will review your dispute and determine if it's valid.</p>\n<p>Chargebacks are typically used when a transaction is erroneous or when purchased goods haven't arrived. They're initiated by the payment network (Visa), allowing you to potentially get your money back without direct merchant involvement.</p>\n<p>Can you provide more details about the purchase or subscription you're seeking a refund for? This will help us better assist you with the chargeback process.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6530721-requesting-chargebacks\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Requesting chargebacks</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090571-understanding-card-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding card transactions</a></p>",
            "Alessio Piano: <p>a merchant made a refund request of one of my payments but after two weeks I didn't see it, what I can do?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>If you haven't received a refund after two weeks, you can take the following steps:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Check your transaction history in the Pliant Cardholder App to see if the refund has been processed.</li>\n<li>If the refund isn't visible, you can initiate a chargeback request. Contact our customer support through the chat in our mobile or web app, or submit a ticket via our Support Form.</li>\n<li>Provide details about the transaction and the merchant's refund request to our support team. They'll review your case and determine if it's valid for a chargeback.</li>\n<li>If approved, the disputed amount will be credited to your account, and you'll see a \"Chargeback\" transaction on your statement.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Remember, chargebacks are typically used for erroneous transactions or when purchased goods haven't arrived, but they can also apply in cases of delayed refunds.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090571-understanding-card-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding card transactions</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6530721-requesting-chargebacks\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Requesting chargebacks</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316732-your-card-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Your card transactions</a></p>",

            "Sener Akkus: <p>Hello, I need my verification code for the next payment. 105 sweet Frank.</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We don't provide verification codes directly. For online transactions, we offer two authentication methods:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>3DS push notification: If your mobile device is paired, you'll receive a push notification to verify the transaction.</li>\n<li>SMS code: If your device isn't paired, you'll get an SMS code to enter on the merchant's verification screen.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If you're having issues with 3DS push notifications, try unpairing and re-pairing your device. You can find instructions on how to do this in our help center.</p>\n<p>For account-specific information, please check your account settings or contact our support team directly.</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7980024-strong-customer-authentication\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Strong-Customer Authentication</a></p>",

        "message(by Christian Kokot)": "<p>Accounting and billing</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you with accounting and billing? </p>",
            "Christian Kokot: <p>K√ºndigung</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We don't have a specific cancellation process for accounting and billing services. However, if you're looking to stop using our services, you can deactivate members in your account. When you deactivate a member, all their active cards will be automatically terminated. Please note that deactivated members can't be deleted, as we need to keep all transaction records. Deactivated users won't be considered in billing, and you can reactivate them later if needed. Only owners and admins can manage member status. If you need further assistance with account changes, please explicitly ask for a human agent in this conversation.</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316745-managing-members\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Managing members</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Did that answer your question?</p>",
            "Christian Kokot: <p>Kompletten Account K√ºndigen</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We don't have a specific process for completely canceling an entire account. However, you can take steps to wind down your account usage:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Deactivate all members in your account. This will automatically terminate their active cards.</li>\n<li>Terminate any remaining cards in the Wallet section.</li>\n<li>Withdraw any remaining funds from your account.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Please note that we need to keep transaction records, so deactivated members can't be fully deleted. If you need further assistance with account closure, please explicitly ask for a human agent in this conversation.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316745-managing-members\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Managing members</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316731-locking-unlocking-and-terminating-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Locking, unlocking and terminating cards</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Is that what you were looking for?</p>",
            "Christian Kokot: <p>Echter Mensch</p>",

            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Kadri Ciga: <p>hi I created a V card how can I view the card details like car number</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>To view the card details of your virtual (V) card, including the card number, follow these steps:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Open the cardholder app and go to the \"My Cards\" section in your wallet.</li>\n<li>Navigate to your desired virtual card using the left and right arrows next to the card image.</li>\n<li>Hover over the card image and click \"Show card details\" to reveal the full card number and CVV.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>You can also copy the card number with a single click to paste it into a merchant's payment interface.</p>\n<p>Remember, only you as the cardholder can access these secure details. For security reasons, never share the card number, CVV, or PIN with anyone else.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090570-access-the-card-details\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Access the card details</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316726-using-your-pliant-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Using your Pliant cards</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>How can we help?</p>",
            "Ayoub El Mansouri: <p>do i get automatically a new creditcard or do i need to order it if iam new </p>",
            "Pliant: <p>As a new user, you don't automatically get a new credit card. You'll need to request one through our app. Here's how:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Log into the Pliant web app.</li>\n<li>Go to the \"Wallet\" section.</li>\n<li>Click the \"Request new card\" button (on web) or tap the plus sign (on mobile).</li>\n<li>Select the card type you want.</li>\n<li>Enter the required details and submit your request.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Your request will be sent to your organization's account owners and admins for approval. You'll receive an email once it's approved. If a physical card is issued, it usually takes 1-2 weeks for delivery.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316725-getting-started-as-a-cardholder\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Getting started as a cardholder</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6460960-requesting-a-card\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Requesting a card</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Wendy Pugmire: <p>Virtuelle Karte ist abgelaufen, soll wieder aktiviert werden</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Unfortunately, it's not possible to reactivate an expired virtual card. When a virtual card expires, you'll need to replace it with a new one. Here's what you can do:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to the \"Wallet\" in your web or mobile cardholder app.</li>\n<li>Click \"Request new card\" (web) or tap the plus sign (mobile).</li>\n<li>Select \"virtual card\" as the card type.</li>\n<li>Enter the required details and reason for the request.</li>\n<li>Submit for approval.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Once approved, your new virtual card will be available instantly. If you need to terminate the old card, you can do so in the Wallet section.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9060891-card-expiration\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card expiration</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316731-locking-unlocking-and-terminating-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Locking, unlocking and terminating cards</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6460960-requesting-a-card\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Requesting a card</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Was that helpful?</p>",
            "Wendy Pugmire: <p>It would have been helpful to get a warning that the card will expire soon</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Currently, we don't have a specific warning system for virtual card expiration. However, you can manage email notifications for various account updates. To set this up:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to your Profile Details in the app.</li>\n<li>Click on \"Manage Notifications\".</li>\n<li>Use the toggles to turn on notifications you want to receive.</li>\n<li>Click \"Save\".</li>\n</ol>\n<p>While this doesn't guarantee a virtual card expiration warning, it may help you stay informed about important account updates. For virtual cards, remember that they can't be extended and need to be replaced with a new one when they expire.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9060891-card-expiration\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card expiration</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6460330-managing-email-notifications\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Managing email notifications</a></p>",

        "message(by Carsten Kirchesch-Madel)": "<p>Accounting and billing</p>",

As a user, you can't change your own email address from the user profile page.</li>\n<li>Only an admin or owner can update a member's email address through the \"Update email address\" button in the member menu.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If you're still unable to access the application, you may need to contact an admin or owner in your organization to verify your email address or request an update if necessary. Make sure you're using the correct method to log in.</li>\n<li>Password problems: If you've forgotten your password, you can request a new one from the login page. For an earlier statement, you have two options:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Access the <a href=\"https://app.getpliant.com/admin/billing-statements\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Statements page</a> and click \"Download\" next to the relevant period once it's available.</li>\n<li>Use the <a href=\"https://app.getpliant.com/admin/account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card account page</a> to generate a live statement. This shows all booked transactions and payments, and you can download it in CSV format. Note that this balance won't include pending transactions.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>For the specific December 31, 2024 balance, the live statement option is your best bet before the official statement is ready.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9507077-billing-statements\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Billing statements</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9515100-card-account-page\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card Account Page</a></p>",
