            "Pliant: <p>The reason you're not receiving SMS for Visa verification on other websites is likely because your mobile device is paired with our app. When paired, you receive 3DS push notifications instead of SMS codes for verification. This applies to online transactions on other websites, while you still receive SMS for accessing your Pliant account.</p>\n<p>If you prefer SMS codes for Visa verification, you can unpair your device. To do this:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Log into the Pliant mobile app</li>\n<li>Go to \"Profile\" and then \"Security\"</li>\n<li>Tap \"Device pairing\" and unpair your device</li>\n</ol>\n<p>After unpairing, you should start receiving SMS codes for Visa verification on other websites again.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7980024-strong-customer-authentication\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Strong-Customer Authentication</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6452385-pairing-a-mobile-device-2fa\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Pairing a mobile device (2FA)</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>I apologize, but your assistant cannot gain access to your cards. For security reasons, only the cardholder can access the secure card details, including the card number, CVV, and PIN. This rule applies to all members of your organization, including owners and admins. Sharing card details with others is strictly prohibited to reduce the risk of fraud and keep your organization's funds secure. If you need a solution for shared expenses, we offer alternatives like assigning multiple members to a team with a shared budget.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090570-access-the-card-details\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Access the card details</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316726-using-your-pliant-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Using your Pliant cards</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316747-managing-cards-via-the-admin-app\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Managing cards via the admin app</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>If you've lost your physical card, here's what you can do:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>First, lock your card immediately to prevent unauthorized use. You can do this in the Wallet section of our web or mobile app by clicking the \"Lock Card\" button.</li>\n<li>To get a replacement, you'll need to terminate the lost card and request a new one. Here's how:<br>‚Ä¢ Go to the Wallet in our app<br>‚Ä¢ Click the edit button for your lost card<br>‚Ä¢ Select \"Terminate card\" and confirm<br>‚Ä¢ Then, click \"Request new card\" (web) or the plus sign (mobile)<br>‚Ä¢ Select physical card type and provide the required details<br>‚Ä¢ Submit the request for approval</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Your request will be sent to your organization's account owners and admins for approval. Once approved, you'll receive an email confirmation. The new physical card typically takes 1-2 weeks to arrive.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6460960-requesting-a-card\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Requesting a card</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316731-locking-unlocking-and-terminating-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Locking, unlocking and terminating cards</a></p>",

This involves identifying and verifying the identity of your company, its legal representatives, and Ultimate Beneficial Owners (UBOs).</p>\n<p>The purpose of this process is to:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Confirm your identity</li>\n<li>Verify your authority to act on behalf of your company</li>\n<li>Understand who we're entering a business relationship with</li>\n<li>Determine if your company is acting on behalf of a UBO</li>\n</ol>\n<p>This helps us comply with regulatory laws and standards, combat financial crimes, and protect our existing customers and the wider community.</p>\n<p>Could you provide more details about the specific \"Compliant Documents Confirm\" button you're referring to?             "Pliant: <p>How can we help?</p>",
            "Jason Mingo: <p>My card was posted on 13/11 but it has still not arrived Can we send it out again or to another address please?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Physical cards usually take 5-10 working days to be delivered after being issued. If your card hasn't arrived yet, it's possible there's been a delay in shipping. Unfortunately, we can't resend the card or change the delivery address directly. The card delivery address can only be updated by an admin or owner of your organization. If you need further assistance, please explicitly ask for a human agent in this conversation, as they can help investigate the status of your card and discuss potential next steps.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090567-card-types-physical-and-virtual-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Card types - physical and virtual cards</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316756-updating-my-organization-s-details\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Updating my organization's details</a></p>",

            "Manuel Schatzmann: <p>We would like to switch our monthly bills to automatic direct debits. What do we need to do?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Good news! Your monthly bills are already set up for automatic direct debits. We use SEPA direct debit (SDD) for bill payments. If you need to change your billing account, here's how:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to the Bank Accounts page in your Pliant app.</li>\n<li>If the desired account is listed, select it and choose \"Set as billing account.\"</li>\n<li>Confirm the SEPA mandate in the dialog.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Note: Only a legal representative can change the billing account. If you need to adjust your payment frequency, please contact our support team through the app chat or our Support Form.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316754-change-the-company-s-billing-account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Change the company‚Äôs billing account</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316752-understanding-billing-statements-and-bill-payments\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding billing statements and bill payments</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>How can we help?</p>",
            "Marcus Hoffmann: <p>my phone number changed</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>You can update your phone number in your Pliant Profile Details. Here's how:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to your Profile Details in the top right corner of the Pliant Web App.</li>\n<li>Click the edit button next to your current phone number.</li>\n<li>Confirm the change, which will trigger an email to your registered address.</li>\n<li>Click the \"Change phone number\" button in the email (valid for 24 hours).</li>\n<li>Log in to your account and enter the new phone number.</li>\n<li>Verify it with the SMS code sent to the new number.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Alternatively, you can change your mobile number by clicking the pen icon next to the phone number in your user profile. This will also trigger an email to reset your number.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090566-your-user-profile\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Your user profile</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7991702-updating-the-phone-number\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Updating The Phone Number</a></p>",

        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you with accounting and billing? </p>",
            "Cees van den Akker: <p>This transaction is only for security. When will the transaction be free of charge?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We don't charge for security transactions. The security key authentication is a feature to verify e-commerce payments, not a charged transaction. However, we do apply fees for FX transactions, which are transactions in a currency different from your card account's currency. The general FX fee is 2%, but your organization may have a special rate. If you're concerned about specific fees, you can check your applicable rates on the Organization &gt; Plan page in your account settings.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9981049-fees-on-fx-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Fees on FX transactions</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9571318-security-key-authentication\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Security Key Authentication</a></p>",

However, if you believe this charge is incorrect, you have options. You can request a chargeback if you think the transaction is erroneous or if there's an issue with the rental service.             "Janina Lipp: <p>Hi, in our credit limit, we have at the moment an amount of more than 40k Euro available, of which 13k Euro are prefunded. Is this going to stay like that if not used until the end of the month / year, or will you return the prefund to our bank account?</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>The prefunded amount of 13k Euro in your credit limit will not automatically be returned to your bank account if unused by the end of the month or year. This prefunded balance remains in your Pliant account until you choose to withdraw it.</p>\n<p>If you want to withdraw the prefunded amount, you can do so through the Payments page in your Pliant account. Click the \"Withdraw\" button, enter the amount you wish to withdraw, and select the bank account for the transfer.             "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "None: <p>I would like to check if there are any other options to approve logins or payments instead of using the sms. It would be great to only use the app for such approvals. Is this possible? Thanks!</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Yes, it's possible to approve logins and payments using only the Pliant mobile app instead of SMS. For logins, you can enable push notifications to your mobile app. To set this up, you need to pair your phone device with your account. Once paired, you'll receive push notifications for login approvals, which you can confirm with a button press on your mobile device.</p>\n<p>For payments, when you pair your mobile device, your cards are automatically set up for 3DS verification through push notifications. You'll be asked to verify online transactions via push notifications from Pliant, eliminating the need for SMS codes.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7325394-two-factor-authentication-2fa-through-push-notification\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Two Factor Authentication (2FA) Through Push Notification</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6452385-pairing-a-mobile-device-2fa\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Pairing a mobile device (2FA)</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7980024-strong-customer-authentication\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Strong-Customer Authentication</a></p>",

        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Jos√© Morata Lorente: <p>Hy dos retenciones pendientes de ejecutar</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>We don't have specific information about managing pending retentions in our system. However, we do handle pending transactions and payments in a few ways:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Pending transactions appear in real-time on the Transactions page as soon as they're authorized. These transactions are in a PENDING state until confirmed by the payment network, which typically happens within a day but can take up to 7 days.</li>\n<li>For bill payments, we account for Pending Bill Payments when calculating the bill payment amount. These are deducted from the closing balance of the period to determine the final bill payment amount.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To get more specific information about managing pending retentions, could you please clarify what type of retentions you're referring to? Are these related to specific transactions, bill payments, or something else?</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316782-exporting-transactions-to-your-company-s-accounting-system\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Exporting transactions to your company's accounting system</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/10028495-bill-payment-reports\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Bill payment reports</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090571-understanding-card-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding card transactions</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Lin Gao: <p>Deposit has been returned, however, in Pliant still \"Ausstehend\".</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>If your deposit is still showing as 'Ausstehend' (pending) in Pliant, it's likely because the process can take 1-3 business days for the money to be credited to your Pliant account. This delay is normal for bank transfers.</p>\n<p>It's important to note that we only accept transfers from bank accounts with the same name as your organization. If you've sent money from a non-bank account (like PayPal) or an account with a different name, the amount will be returned to the sender and may not be reflected immediately in your Pliant account.</p>\n<p>If you're concerned about the status of your deposit, please contact our support team through the chat in our mobile or web app, or submit a ticket via our Support Form for further assistance.</p>\n<p><br>Source:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7924887-pre-fund-pliant-account\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Pre-fund Pliant Account</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>You can find the last 4 digits of your card number in a few ways:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>On the physical card itself, if you've received it.</li>\n<li>In the Pliant cardholder app:<br>‚Ä¢ Go to the Wallet section<br>‚Ä¢ Navigate to your card using the arrows next to the card image<br>‚Ä¢ Click \"Show card details\" to reveal the full card number</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Remember, you'll need to activate your physical card before using it. The available balance typically changes one bank working day after the bill payment is booked in our system, not when it's triggered.</li>\n<li>Your company might have reached its organizational limit, which is separate from individual card limits. Our billing statements aggregate all card transactions, including any fees, into a single statement for simplicity. The monthly statement includes all booked transactions and payments for the period.</p>\n<p>For specific fees like FX transactions, they are calculated per transaction and then summed up at the end of each calendar month. The combined amount is added to the overall monthly invoice. You can find detailed information about all transactions and fees in the monthly statement PDF or the comprehensive CSV file available on our Statements page.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316752-understanding-billing-statements-and-bill-payments\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding billing statements and bill payments</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9507077-billing-statements\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Billing statements</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9981049-fees-on-fx-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Fees on FX transactions</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>There are several reasons why your transaction might have been cancelled and your card blocked for security reasons:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Failed Strong Customer Authentication (SCA): This can happen if the Pliant app needs updating, the merchant didn't request SCA, you entered the SMS code incorrectly, or the payment was cancelled.</li>\n<li>Temporary 3DS function blocking: This can occur after cancellations or incorrect code entries as a protective measure.</li>\n<li>Declined transaction: This could be due to various reasons like a locked card, exceeded limits, wrong PIN, or disallowed merchant.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To resolve this, please contact our support team through the chat in our mobile or web app, or submit a ticket via our Support Form. It's great for detailed analysis of expenditures. You can download it from the Statements page using the \"Download\" button.</li>\n<li>Transaction export: On the Transactions page in the admin app, you can use the 'Download' button to get a CSV file of all transactions you've searched or filtered for.             "Graeme McCoy: <p>I want to set up my digital card</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>To set up your digital card, you have a couple of options. First, you can issue a virtual card through our web app. Here's how:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Go to the Cards page in our app.</li>\n<li>Click \"Issue new card\" in the top right.</li>\n<li>Choose the member for whom you want to issue the card.</li>\n<li>Select \"Virtual\" as the card type.</li>\n<li>Set the card limits and other settings.</li>\n<li>Click \"Issue card\" to confirm.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Virtual cards are available and active instantly after issuance.</p>\n<p>Additionally, you can add your Pliant card to Apple Pay for digital use. All our cards, including virtual ones, can be added to Apple Wallet. This allows you to use Apple Pay both in stores and online.</p>\n<p>If you need any further assistance, please don't hesitate to ask.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316746-issuing-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Issuing cards</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6590460-using-apple-pay-with-pliant\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Using Apple Pay with Pliant</a></p>",

If your digital card is not available to use after requesting it, there could be a few reasons:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>The request may not have been approved yet. Card requests are sent to your organization's account owners and admins for approval. You should receive an email once the request has been approved.</li>\n<li>There might have been an issue during the card issuance process. In this case, it's best to check with your account administrator to ensure the card was successfully issued.</li>\n<li>There could be a technical glitch in the app. Try logging out and back in, or updating the app to the latest version.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If the issue persists, we recommend contacting our support team for further assistance. They can help identify and resolve any specific problems with your virtual card activation.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6460960-requesting-a-card\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Requesting a card</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316746-issuing-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Issuing cards</a><br><a href=\"https://www.getpliant.com/en/pricing/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Pricing | Pliant</a></p>",

            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "Angelique de Wijs: <p>My colleague's card has been hacked and misused by someone else</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>If your colleague's card has been hacked and misused, here are the steps to take:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Lock the card immediately: Your colleague should lock their card in the cardholder web or mobile app to prevent further unauthorized transactions.</li>\n<li>Report the suspicious activity: Contact our support team as soon as possible. This can be done via the chat in our web and mobile app or by submitting a ticket through our Support Form.</li>\n<li>Initiate a chargeback: For any fraudulent transactions, your colleague can request a chargeback. We'll review and resolve the case in collaboration with Visa.</li>\n<li>Terminate the compromised card: After reporting, your colleague should terminate the card to permanently disable it.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Remember, card details should never be shared with others to prevent such incidents.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316726-using-your-pliant-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Using your Pliant cards</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9653605-visa-fraud-prevention-measures\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Visa fraud prevention measures</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316731-locking-unlocking-and-terminating-cards\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Locking, unlocking and terminating cards</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090571-understanding-card-transactions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Understanding card transactions</a></p>",

That information is needed in Moco in order to make a smooth assigning of expenses possible.</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>While we don't have specific information about Moco integration, here's how you can ensure project-relevant information is captured in Pliant:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Use the comment/note feature in Pliant for each transaction. All users can add comments via web or mobile app.</li>\n<li>When preparing transactions for export, you can assign projects/cost units to individual transactions.</li>\n<li>For automation, you can assign projects/cost units directly to credit cards. This way, new transactions on that card are automatically assigned the linked project.</li>\n<li>During export, comments are typically included in the exported data, which should transfer to your accounting system.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>For specific Moco integration details, please contact our support team for assistance.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/9219590-comment-note\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Comment/Note</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316748-tracking-card-transactions-in-the-admin-app\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Tracking card transactions in the admin app</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6455021-setting-up-cost-units-projects\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Setting up cost units (projects)</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316779-preparing-transactions-for-export\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Preparing transactions for export</a></p>",

        "message(by None)": "<p>Other</p>",
        "replies": [
            "Pliant: <p>How can we help you?</p>",
            "None: <p>I am currently going through the Onboarding Step Directors &amp; Shareholders. Only one of two are marked as Gesetzlicher Vertreter</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>The term 'Gesetzlicher Vertreter' (legal representative) is used to identify individuals who have the authority to act on behalf of the company. In your case, only one of two directors or shareholders is marked as such because they likely have the primary legal authority to represent the company.</p>\n<p>This distinction is important for our know-your-customer (KYC) due diligence process, which is required by financial regulations. We need to identify and verify the identity of the company's legal representatives to confirm they are entitled to enter into a business relationship with us on behalf of the company.</p>\n<p>If no clear Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO) exists, we may need to determine a fictive UBO, which could be the managing director or legal representative of the company. This might explain why one person is specifically marked as 'Gesetzlicher Vertreter'.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7178403-identification\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Identification</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7178338-ultimate-beneficial-owner-ubo\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)</a></p>",
            "Pliant: <p>Was that helpful?</p>",
            "None: <p>Both are legal representatives of the company</p>",
            "Pliant: <p>During the onboarding process, you can designate multiple individuals as legal representatives. All legal representatives will need to undergo identification and answer KYC-related questions. To ensure proper representation, you can assign these individuals as Owners in our system. Owners have full control of the company's Pliant account and can manage other roles. If you need to adjust role assignments after initial setup, you can do so later. For specific assistance with designating multiple legal representatives, please ask to speak with a human agent who can guide you through the process.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/7178403-identification\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Identification</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090556-member-roles-and-permissions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Member roles and permissions</a></p>",

However, during the onboarding process, you can designate multiple individuals as legal representatives. All legal representatives will need to undergo identification and answer KYC-related questions.</p>\n<p>To ensure proper representation, you can assign these individuals as Owners in our system. Owners have full control of the company's Pliant account and can manage other roles. The role assignments can be chosen when inviting new members and can be changed later if needed.</p>\n<p>For specific assistance with designating multiple legal representatives, please explicitly ask to speak with a human agent who can guide you through the process.</p>\n<p><br>Sources:<br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6316745-managing-members\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Managing members</a><br><a href=\"https://help.getpliant.com/en/articles/6090556-member-roles-and-permissions\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"intercom-content-link\">Member roles and permissions</a></p>",
